casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Claude Alexander MILLER, also known as Kevin Miller, Defendant-Appellant. No. 10-10079

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Aug. 17, 2010. Nancy E. Larson, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Northern District of Texas, Fort Worth, TX, Christy Lee Drake, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Amarillo, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. William Reynolds Biggs, Assistant Federal Public Defender, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Dallas, TX, Bonita L. Gun-den, Assistant Federal Public Defender, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Amarillo, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Claude Alexander Miller Farwell, TX, pro se. Before DAVIS, SMITH, and WIENER, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:*

The Federal Public Defender appointed to represent Claude Alexander Miller has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Miller has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no non-frivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
